New Records: Philadelphia Phillies set a new season high for runs scored with 16 runs against the Miami Marlins
Key Match Events: Zack Wheeler allowed just one run on two hits and a walk in six innings, striking out seven for a second straight game
J.T. Realmuto exited in the fourth with a left knee contusion
Johan Rojas became the first Phillie this season to double three times in the same game
Pre-Game Insights: The Marlins' starter, Edward Cabrera, was scratched an hour before first pitch with migraine-like symptoms
The Phillies' bats were prepared to face any combination of bullpen arms the Marlins would throw
Post-Match Reflections: Zack Wheeler said a Cy Young Award would mean a lot to him, but he's just trying to go out there and put up zeros and hope for the best
Manager Rob Thomson said Wheeler was good, with command and a lot of strikes, and he could have gone more but it was silly to run him out for a seventh inning with that big of a lead
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' offense absolutely demolished almost every pitch it saw, racking up 22 hits, a season high
All nine of the Phils' starters had at least one hit, and four had three-hit nights
The Phillies extended their win streak to six games for the first time since May 17-23
